title: Sitar
summary: The sitar (English:  /ˈsɪtɑːr/ or /sɪˈtɑːr/; IAST: sitāra) is a plucked stringed instrument, originating from the Indian subcontinent, used in Hindustani classical music. The instrument was invented in around 9th century medieval India and its use of it flourished in the 16th and 17th centuries and at its present form in 18th-century India. It's parent musical instrument is the ancient thousands years old Indian Veena.
